Even if it's just an aesthetic thing, that would definitely be a pretty cool addition!
Or: honeycomb layers outside and honey inside (magma cube -like)

What About Calling It a Goo If Its Added Or Smthing Other Than Honey Slime (Nothing Wrong With The Name Honey Slime)
Maybe it could steal honey from bees? That could be how it got covered in honey!
It would be cool if the only way to kill it is by bottling it up.

Possible Mechanics:

Slimes start out at different sizes; honey slimes start out only as mini. They'd spawn in groups of 1-3 around full bees nests in a slime chunk. Mini HS can be killed, but with no loot.

If two or more mini HS bounce into each other, they can merge into a larger size; from Small => Medium => Large. Small and up can drop loot, but there's a twist.

When HS are killed, honeycombs will drop. Maybe rates of 1-2,-2-4, and 3-7 for S,M, and L. The "Looting" enchantment can affect how many honeycombs are dropped.

If the HS is killed while there is an empty bottle in the off hand, the bottle will fill up with honey. The "Looting" enchantment should not affect this, both for "farm" rates and ease of code.

This would offer an alternative to both honey collection and honeycomb collection. Spawn rates would be low enough that the HS could be farmed, but the rate of honey bottles produced would not be more efficient than current honey and honeycomb farms.

The advantage to honey slime farms would be that the bees nests do not need to be disturbed, fewer bees nests would be needed, and more honeycombs could be produced. However, the player has to be actively involved in the farm, there would be no active bees to pollenate crops, and the farm has to be built in specific biomes/chunks.

Since 1.17 introduces candles, there will be a higher need for honeycomb. Honey slimes would offer players a way to produce more candles, but at a cost.

I have a few suggestions for the mob that would be perfect for it:

- They are neutral mobs like the Tropical Slime in MC Earth since they're made from something passive

- They spawn in the Flower Forest Biome

- They cover the player in slime once attacked slowing them down and making it difficult to jump
And they should also slowly slide on blocks when falling.

New carnivorous plants.

I have an idea for this, If the wither sees a zombie or skeleton, it would convert the mob into it's withered variant. It should only work for those 2 mobs, because it would cause too much confusion for withered zombie pig men, and what not.
Does a potion of death instantly kill you? If so I think that is a little over powered.

Maybe a better solution would be to not have fish spawn near an ocean monument.  The mechanic of guardians killing fish could be a cool fish farm for someone who is willing to capture guardians and transport them elsewhere.  Although them completely destroying the drops would also work if they place the guardians in the ocean outside the farm to make the farm produce better.

I would like to add a follow up with a behaviour for cows- a napping animation! Cows in real life doze on the ground a lot, and I think it would be cute to walk out into your fields early in the morning, and all your cows are sleeping. Sheep too.
Chickens should peck and scratch the ground. Horses should roll occasionally. Pigs should play in mud. Cows should lay down. MORE MINECRAFT ANIMALS NEED ANIMATIONS LIKE THE FOXES AND CAMELS HAVE!

Maybe it's temperature-dependent, instead of biome, similar to the frog variants. Sniffers could have a light blue-green back in cold biomes, regular green in temperate biomes, and some golden hue in hot biomes. And similarly having at least 3 ancient plants per temperature-based area would give extra usage out of sniffers.
